resources.string: Are you sure you want to permanently clear your favorites list?
Are you sure you want to permanently clear your bookmarks list?
Tap the Add to Favorites icon to save your favorite words to this list.
Tap the Bookmark icon to save your favorite sections to this list.

To search the lexicon, tap the magnifying glass icon. You can use either Greek characters or Beta code to search. Diacritics are optional in both cases. For example, you can search for λόγος by typing \"logos.\" Search queries are not case sensitive.

To switch between modes, open the navigation drawer by swiping in from the left edge of the screen or tapping the application icon in the upper-left corner.

To submit a bug report, select the Send Feedback option from the menu.

This app\'s source code is available under an open source license at https://github.com/blinskey/greek-reference.

Thanks to the Perseus Digital Library and Jeffrey A. Rydberg-Cox for making available the texts used in this app. Visit Dr. Rydberg-Cox\'s web site at http://daedalus.umkc.edu.

This app includes the text of An Intermediate Greek-English Lexicon, by Henry George Liddell and Robert Scott. Text provided by Perseus Digital Library, with funding from The Annenberg CPB/Project. Original version available for viewing and download at http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/. I have made a number of corrections to the original text.

The app also includes the text of Overview of Greek Syntax, by Jeffrey A. Rydberg-Cox. Text provided by Perseus Digital Library, with funding from The Annenberg CPB/Project. Original version available for viewing and download at http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/.

The above texts are licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 United States License. See http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0/us/ for details.

The icons used in this app are taken from the Google Material Design Icons set, licensed under a Creative Common Attribution 4.0 International license.

The following additional open source resources were used in the development of this app. Thanks to their creators for making their work available.

  • SQLiteAssetHelper

  • EpiDoc TransCoder

  • Noto Serif font

This app\'s icon was constructed in part from an icon obtained from the "Boilerplate" icon set available at www.androidicons.com. The icon set is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. See http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ for details.
